lj.lj_ly: he had been a burr under the saddle of the government in his time.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English  (sense 5): probably of Scandinavian origin and related to Danish burre 'bur, burdock', Swedish kard-borre 'burdock'

entry.def: A burr is the part of some plants which contains seeds and which has little hooks on the outside so that it sticks to clothes or fur.

entry.tran: （英语方言中的）颤动小舌的r音，粗喉音
entry.def: If someone has a burr, they speak English with a regional accent in which 'r' sounds are pronounced more strongly than in the standard British way of speaking.

example.tran: 一种热情的英格兰西南部小舌颤音

means.word_mean: 1. seed vessel having hooks or prickles
2. rough projection left on a workpiece after drilling or cutting
3. rotary file for smoothing rough edges left on a workpiece
4. small bit used in dentistry or surgery
